choose:  
A. I descend and then fly forward.  
B. I go up and turn left.  
C. I fly forward while rising.  
D. I turn right and descend.  
E. I rotate the camera downward.

According to the navigation instruction, the next step involves getting down to the chairs between the buildings and staying there. To achieve this, the agent needs to first locate these chairs, which likely requires a downward view to identify their exact position amidst the buildings. Therefore, rotating the camera downward is the best next step to spot the chairs and plan the descent accurately.
